publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4294 Sarah Boyack: 64 for Aung San Suu Kyi—That the Parliament recognises Nobel Peace Prize winner Aung San Suu Kyi’s role as an important symbol of hope for democracy in Burma; takes the opportunity of her 64th birthday on 19 June 2009 to commend her for her longstanding bravery and inspirational defence of human rights and democratic freedoms against the country’s repressive military regime, and supports the initiative, involving human rights groups such as Amnesty International and Human Rights Watch, calling on people to write 64-word messages of support for Aung San Suu Kyi to mark her 64th birthday.
S3M-4294 64 for Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 2 June 2009) Jamie Hepburn*

S3M-4294 Sarah Boyack: 64 for Aung San Suu Kyi—That the Parliament recognises Nobel Peace Prize winner Aung San Suu Kyi’s role as an important symbol of hope for democracy in Burma; takes the opportunity of her 64th birthday on 19 June 2009 to commend her for her longstanding bravery and inspirational defence of human rights and democratic freedoms against the country’s repressive military regime, and supports the initiative, involving human rights groups such as Amnesty International and Human Rights Watch, calling on people to write 64-word messages of support for Aung San Suu Kyi to mark her 64th birthday. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn
S3M-4294 64 for Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 2 June 2009) Malcolm Chisholm*, Trish Godman*
S3M-4294 64 for Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 2 June 2009) Marlyn Glen*, Karen Whitefield*
S3M-4294 64 for Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 2 June 2009) Rhoda Grant*
